sub_title: Historian Ph.D., Research professional, Text editor, הִיסטוֹרִיוֹן
summary:
After completing compulsory military service, Pim Griffioen studied at the Free University (Vrije Universiteit, VU) in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. In August 1993 he obtained his master's degree (M.A.) in History, after which he worked as a historian at the Ghetto Fighters'​ House Museum, Archives and Study Center in Israel. During the 1994–1995 academic year (two semesters) he studied part-time Modern Jewish History and History of the Holocaust at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat-Gan. Since 1998 he has worked as a contract researcher for, successively, the Netherlands Institute for War Documentation (NIOD), the Netherlands Organization for Scientific Research (NWO), and the University of Constance (Universität Konstanz). He received his Ph.D. degree in History from the University of Amsterdam (UvA) in 2008.

The book publication of his doctoral dissertation, carried out jointly with Ron Zeller, “The Persecution of the Jews in the Netherlands, France and Belgium, 1940–1945: Similarities, Differences, Causes”, was a finalist of the 2012 Yad Vashem Book Prize for Scholarly Studies published in 2011. 

He was a postdoctoral research fellow at the International Institute for Holocaust Research of Yad Vashem, Jerusalem, Israel, 2010-2011, and his postdoctoral research project was awarded Saul Kagan fellowships for the 2013–2015 academic years by the Claims Conference Research Fellowships program in Advanced Shoah Studies. Between October 1, 2016, and April 1, 2017, he was a fellow at the Institute for Advanced Study (IAS), Center of Excellence, University of Constance (Exzellenzcluster, Kulturwissenschaftliches Kolleg der Universität Konstanz), Seeburg address, Kreuzlingen, Switzerland. 
Currently, he is a project researcher, part-time, for the Jewish Cultural Quarter (JCK), Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

His scholarly work has been published in six languages in various peer-reviewed journals, including: The Netherlands'​ Journal of Social Sciences, Holocaust and Genocide Studies, Yad Vashem Studies, Zagłada Żydów: Studia i Materiały, Cahiers d'Histoire du Temps Présent, Perspectives, Einsicht, and Sozialgeschichte.

For references to publications (books, articles, papers) and reviews/responses, in English, see Academia.edu: https://uni-konstanz.academia.edu/PimGriffioen/

Specialties:

Scientific research, archival research, press research; information classification and analysis; reporting and reviewing; verification inquiry; translation into Dutch and text editing; publishing and lecturing through (international) colloquia, seminars, etc.

education.degree_name: Doctorandus (drs, equivalent of Master of Arts/Magister Artium, M.A.)

awards.title: Elected member MdNL 2009
awards.description: On account of scholarly merits as a historian elected as member of the Society of Dutch Literature (Maatschappij der Nederlandse Letterkunde, MdNL) in 2009.
awards.issuer: Maatschappij der Nederlandse Letterkunde (MdNL, Society of Dutch Literature), Leiden, established in 1766.

awards.title: Hartog Beem-Prijs, KNAW, 1995
awards.description: An unpublished comparative historical study on the persecution of the Jews in the Netherlands and Belgium, 1940–1945, 161 pages, co-authored with Ron Zeller, was awarded the Hartog Beem Prize 1995 by the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW), Commission for the History and Culture of the Jews in the Netherlands; Chair: Prof. Dr M.E.H.N. (Nicolette) Mout. Jury: Prof. Dr H.W. von der Dunk (chairman), Dr W.C. Pieterse, Drs J.C.E. Belinfante.
awards.issuer: Koninklijke Nederlandse Akademie van Wetenschappen (KNAW, Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences), Amsterdam, established in 1808.

profile_positions.description:
Project researcher, part-time, for the Jewish Cultural Quarter (JCK), Amsterdam. 
The Jewish Cultural Quarter includes: 
- the Jewish Museum, 
- the Jewish Museum junior, 
- the Portuguese Synagogue, 
- the Holocaust memorial site Hollandsche Schouwburg, 
- the National Holocaust Museum (in development).
profile_positions.title: Project researcher

profile_positions.description: Researcher, part-time, as part of an international, multidisciplinary research project. Updating and editing of part of research results.

profile_positions.description:
Local investigator, part-time, for the Netherlands in the multidisciplinary research project ‘Holocaust and “Polycracy” in Western Europe, 1940–1944’, University of Constance (Universität Konstanz), Germany. Funded by the VW-Stiftung (Hannover, Germany)  and the Fondation pour la Mémoire de la Shoah (Paris, France).
Cf.: Uni'Kon 08/2002 (Konstanz Universitätsverlag), Titelthema, pp. 2–5.
